Match
and Compare

Find a suitable healthy match from our proprietary database of Danish microbiome profiles. This match will serve as the customer's ideal bacterial goal and will be the basis of the personalized probiotic.

Matching process

Finding your perzonalized baseline

How would your microbiome look if you were the healthiest version of yourself? If we could find this healthier version of you, we would know.

We have gathered a diverse array of microbiome profiles from some of the healthiest people in Denmark, this database represents people from all age groups and dietary lifestyles.

By matching you with the most similar healthy individual from our database, we find the bacterial baseline most suited for you.

The healthy danish microbiome database project

A database of elite subjects

We’re building a database of microbiome profiles of healthy danish subjects. The subjects are selected after passing a rigorous selection to ensure, among other things:

  • Absence of autoimmune conditions
  • Absence of gastrointestinal symptoms
  • Healthy hormonal balance markers
  • Regular exercise habits
  • Healthy sleep habits
  • Healthy cardiovascular endurance
  • Non-smoker
  • Healthy BMI range
  • Absence of depression and anxiety symptoms
  • Absence of food allergies

Learn More

WHAT IS THE PURPOSE OF COMPARING THE GUT MICROBIOME OF TWO PEOPLE?

Comparing the gut microbiomes of two people helps us develop a personalized targeted treatment based on the specific makeup of an individual’s gut microbiome and the differences with a healthy match. This way, we can develop a specific probiotic blend designed to restore the balance of the gut microbiome for the individual customer, which may be more effective than non-personalized products.

WHAT FACTORS MIGHT INFLUENCE DIFFERENCES IN GUT MICROBIOMES BETWEEN INDIVIDUALS?

There are many factors that may influence differences in gut microbiomes between individuals. Some examples include:

  • Diet: The types and amounts of foods that a person consumes can have a significant impact on the gut microbiome. For example, diets that are high in fiber, fruits, and vegetables tend to be associated with a more diverse and healthy gut microbiome, while diets that are high in processed or sugary foods may be associated with an imbalance in the gut microbiome.
  • Lifestyle: Lifestyle factors such as physical activity, stress, and sleep patterns can also influence the gut microbiome. For example, regular physical activity and adequate sleep may be associated with a healthier gut microbiome, while chronic stress may disrupt the balance of the gut microbiome.
  • Genetics: Genetics play a role in the makeup and function of the gut microbiome. For example, studies have found that individuals who are related tend to have more similar gut microbiomes compared to unrelated individuals.
  • Environment: The environment in which a person lives and the exposure to various microorganisms can also influence the gut microbiome. For example, studies have found that individuals who live in rural areas tend to have a more diverse gut microbiome compared to those who live in urban areas.
  • Age: The gut microbiome tends to change over the course of a person’s lifetime, with differences often observed between infants, children, adults, and the elderly.
  • Sex: Studies have also found differences in the gut microbiome between (biological) men and women, although the exact reasons for these differences are not fully understood.
WHAT IS THE ROLE OF PROBIOTIC PILLS?

Probiotic pills are a type of dietary supplement that contain live microorganisms, usually bacteria, that are similar to the beneficial microorganisms found in the human gut. These microorganisms are often called “good” or “helpful” bacteria because they can help keep the gut microbiome balanced and healthy.

Probiotic pills are taken orally, and the microorganisms are intended to colonize the gut microbiome and provide a variety of health benefits.
